questions.question: This is very heady punch, so watch your step.
questions.explanation: A compound sentence has two or more coordinate clauses.

questions.question: I don’t know what I should do now.
questions.explanation: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: The helicopter hovered over the house.
questions.explanation: A simple sentence has just one subject and one predicate.

questions.question: A howl of protest went up when the voting was announced.
questions.explanation: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: He became rich through wise investments.
questions.explanation: A simple sentence has just one subject and one predicate.

questions.question:
What type of sentence is this?
 I absolutely love to see the lion tamer perform!

Read the following sentence and identify the sentence type:
 Pauline loves to go to the beach and spend her days sunbathing.
questions.explanation: A simple sentence has just one subject and one predicate.

questions.question:
Read the sentence and choose the answer that identifies the type of sentence:
 Before the sun rises, she runs two miles or exercises.
questions.explanation: A complex sentence has one main clause and one or more subordinate clauses.

questions.question: A sentence with two or more independent, or main, clauses with two ideas of equal importance is called a

Identify the sentence type.
After school Christopher fed the snakes and Matthew looked after the guinea pigs.
questions.explanation: A compound sentence has two or more coordinate clauses.
